commit_message:
[admin-guide] remove deprecated namespace deletion options

Change-Id: Idb076a8dc49201197ba30ebc0ee1e36b6cde290c
Closes-Bug: #1509413
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/61/331461/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. note:: For iproute version 3.12.0 and above, networking namespaces are configured to be deleted by default. This behavior can be changed for both DHCP and L3 agents. The configuration files are ``/etc/neutron/dhcp_agent.ini`` and ``/etc/neutron/l3_agent.ini`` respectively. For DHCP namespace the configuration key: ``dhcp_delete_namespaces = True``. You can set it to ``False`` in case namespaces cannot be deleted cleanly on the host running the DHCP agent. For L3 namespace, the configuration key: ``router_delete_namespaces = True``. You can set it to False in case namespaces cannot be deleted cleanly on the host running the L3 agent.

commit_message:
[cli-ref] update trove-manage command to 5.0.1

Change-Id: Ia36f631c696a229d349275a81d33d68bfd4bd57f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/68/331468/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This chapter documents :command:`trove-manage` version ``5.0.1``. [--log-dir LOG_DIR] [--log-file PATH] [--nodebug] [--nouse-syslog] [--noverbose] [--nowatch-log-file] [--verbose] [--version] [--watch-log-file] {db_sync,db_upgrade,db_downgrade,datastore_update, datastore_version_update,db_recreate, db_load_datastore_config_parameters, datastore_version_flavor_add, datastore_version_flavor_delete} The name of a logging configuration file. This file is appended to any existing logging configuration files. For details about logging configuration files, see the Python logging module documentation. Note that when logging configuration files are used then all logging configuration is set in the configuration file and other logging configuration options are ignored (for example, ``logging_context_format_string``). This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. (Optional) Name of log file to send logging output to. If no default is set, logging will go to stderr as defined by ``use_stderr``. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. If set to false, the logging level will be set to ``WARNING`` instead of the default ``INFO`` level.``--watch-log-file`` Uses logging handler designed to watch file system. When log file is moved or removed this handler will open a new log file with specified path instantaneously. It makes sense only if ``log_file`` option is specified and Linux platform is used. This option is ignored if ``log_config_append`` is set. **positional arguments:****optional arguments:****positional arguments:** Comma separated list of flavor ids. **optional arguments:****positional arguments:****optional arguments:****positional arguments:****optional arguments:****positional arguments:****optional arguments:****positional arguments:****optional arguments:****optional arguments:****optional arguments:****optional arguments:**

This file is appended to any existing logging configuration files. For details about logging configuration files, see the Python logging module documentation. (Optional) Name of log file to output to. If no default is set, logging will go to stdout. ``--log-format FORMAT`` **DEPRECATED**. A logging.Formatter log message format string which may use any of the available ``logging.LogRecord`` attributes. This option is deprecated. Please use ``logging_context_format_string`` and ``logging_default_format_string`` instead. ``--use-syslog-rfc-format`` (Optional) Enables or disables syslog rfc5424 format for logging. If enabled, prefixes the MSG part of the syslog message with APP-NAME (RFC5424). The format without the APP-NAME is **deprecated** in Kilo, and will be removed in Mitaka, along with this option. If set to false, will disable ``INFO`` logging level, making ``WARNING`` the default.Positional arguments --------------------Optional arguments ------------------Positional arguments -------------------- Comma separated list of flavor ids. subject: Overcloud is not able to deploy with the default 4GB of RAM using instack-undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 11:01:43.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/instack-virt-setup'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/6059d47383ab79dff84b495588a65cfafb31132a', 'message': 'Overcloud is not able to deploy with the default 4GB of RAM using instack-undercloud

When deploying the overcloud with the default value of 4GB of RAM the overcloud fails throwing "Cannot allocate memory" errors.
By increasing the default memory to 5GB the error is solved in instack-undercloud

Change-Id: I29036edeebefc1959643a04c5396e72863fdca5f
Closes-Bug: #1563750
(cherry picked from commit 2dec7d7521799c0323d076cd66ba71ebb444c706)
'}]
commit_message:
Overcloud is not able to deploy with the default 4GB of RAM using instack-undercloud

When deploying the overcloud with the default value of 4GB of RAM the overcloud fails throwing "Cannot allocate memory" errors.
By increasing the default memory to 5GB the error is solved in instack-undercloud

Change-Id: I29036edeebefc1959643a04c5396e72863fdca5f
Closes-Bug: #1563750
(cherry picked from commit 2dec7d7521799c0323d076cd66ba71ebb444c706)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/74/329874/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export NODE_MEM=${NODE_MEM:-5120}
deleted_lines: export NODE_MEM=${NODE_MEM:-4096}

added_lines: def check_keystone_nodes(nodes): hiera_hosts = [] for node in nodes: cmd = "cat /etc/hiera/plugins/detach-keystone.yaml" result = self.ssh_manager.execute_on_remote( ip=node['ip'], cmd=cmd, yamlify=True )['stdout_yaml'] hosts = result['corosync_roles'] logger.debug("hosts on {0} are {1}".format(node['hostname'], hosts)) if not hiera_hosts: hiera_hosts = hosts continue else: assert_true(set(hosts) == set(hiera_hosts), 'Hosts on node {0} differ from ' 'others'.format(node['hostname'])) check_keystone_nodes(keystone_nodes) check_keystone_nodes(keystone_nodes)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/75/331575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-06-19 15:48+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-06-19 10:07+0000\n""A single network can be assigned to more than one DHCP agents and one DHCP " "agent can host more than one network. You can add a network to a DHCP agent " "and remove one from it." msgstr "" "1 つのネットワークを複数の DHCP エージェントに割り当てることもできますし、 1 " "つの DHCP エージェントで複数のネットワークを担当することもできます。ネット" "ワークを DHCP エージェントに追加したり、DHCP エージェントから削除したりできま" "す。" msgid ""msgid "" "Admin role is required to use the agent management and scheduler extensions. " "Ensure you run the following commands under a project with an admin role." msgstr "" "エージェント管理およびスケジューラー拡張機能を使用するには管理ロールが必要で" "す。以下のコマンドは管理ロールを持つプロジェクトで実行してください。" "After the agent is disabled, you can safely remove the agent. Even after " "disabling the agent, resources on the agent are kept assigned. Ensure you " "remove the resources on the agent before you delete the agent." msgstr "" "エージェントを無効にした後、そのエージェントは安全に削除できます。エージェン" "トを無効化した後も、そのエージェント上のリソースは割り当てられたままです。" "エージェントを削除する前に、エージェント上のリソースを削除してください。" msgid ""msgid "" "After you stop the DHCP agent on HostA, you can delete it by the following " "command:" msgstr "" "HostA の DHCP エージェントを停止した後で、以下のコマンドでエージェントを削除" "できます。" "An administrator might want to disable an agent if a system hardware or " "software upgrade is planned. Some agents that support scheduling also " "support disabling and enabling agents, such as L3 and DHCP agents. After the " "agent is disabled, the scheduler does not schedule new resources to the " "agent." msgstr "" "管理者は、システムのハードウェアやソフトウェアのアップグレードを計画している" "場合、エージェントを無効化したいことでしょう。 L3 エージェントや DHCP エー" "ジェントなど、スケジューリングに対応しているエージェントのいくつかでは、エー" "ジェントの有効化、無効化ができます。エージェントを無効にすると、スケジュー" "ラーはそれ以降はそのエージェントに新たにリソースをスケジューリングしません。" msgid """Boot a VM on ``net2``. Let both DHCP agents host ``net2``. Fail the agents " "in turn to see if the VM can still get the desired IP." msgstr "" "``net2`` に VM を起動して、両方の DHCP エージェントに ``net2`` を担当させま" "す。これらのエージェントを順番に故障させて、 エージェントが故障した場合でも " "VM が所望の IP アドレスを取得できることを確認します。" msgid "Boot a VM on ``net2``:" msgstr "VM を ``net2`` 上に起動します。" msgid """Create subnet pools specifying the name (or UUID) of the address scope that " "the subnet pool belongs to. If you have existing subnet pools, use the " "``subnetpool-update`` command to put them in a new address scope:" msgstr "" "サブネットプールが所属するアドレススコープの名前 (または UUID) を指定してサブ" "ネットプールを作成します。既存のサブネットプールがある場合、 ``subnetpool-" "update`` コマンドを使って、既存のサブネットプールを新しいアドレススコープに所" "属させることもできます。" msgid ""msgid "Demo setup" msgstr "デモ環境の構成" msgid "Disable the DHCP agent on HostA before you stop it:" msgstr "HostA のエージェントを停止する前に無効化します。" msgid "Disabling and removing an agent" msgstr "エージェントの無効化と削除" msgid "Enabling DHCP high availability by default" msgstr "デフォルトで DHCP の高可用性を有効にする" msgid "HA of DHCP agents" msgstr "DHCP エージェントの HA" "If there is a default, it can be requested by passing :option:`--use-default-" "subnetpool` instead of :option:`--subnetpool SUBNETPOOL`." msgstr "" "デフォルトのサブネットプールがある場合は、 :option:`--subnetpool SUBNETPOOL` " "の代わりに :option:`--use-default-subnetpool` を使ってアドレスを確保すること" "もできます。" msgid ""msgid "" "In the above configuration, we use ``dhcp_agents_per_network = 1`` for this " "demonstration. In usual deployments, we suggest setting " "``dhcp_agents_per_network`` to more than one to match the number of DHCP " "agents in your deployment. See :ref:`conf-dhcp-agents-per-network`." msgstr "" "上記の設定では、デモ用に ``dhcp_agents_per_network = 1`` を使用しています。通" "常の環境では、 ``dhcp_agents_per_network`` をお使いの環境の DHCP エージェント" "数に合うように複数に設定することをお薦めします。 :ref:`conf-dhcp-agents-per-" "network` を参照してください。" msgid "" "Make sure that subnets on an external networks are created from the subnet " "pools created above:" msgstr "" "外部ネットワークのサブネットは、上記で作成したサブネットプールから作成してく" "ださい。" msgid "Managing agents in neutron deployment" msgstr "neutron 環境でのエージェントの管理" msgid "Managing assignment of networks to DHCP agent" msgstr "DHCP エージェントへのネットワーク割り当ての管理" msgid "OpenStack controller host - controlnode" msgstr "OpenStack コントローラーホスト - controlnode" msgid "Prerequisites for demonstration" msgstr "デモの前提条件" "The ``default_prefixlen`` defines the subnet size you will get if you do not " "specify :option:`--prefixlen` when creating a subnet." msgstr "" "``default_prefixlen`` は、サブネット作成時に :option:`--prefixlen` が指定され" "なかった場合に割り当てるサブネットのサイズを定義します。" msgid ""msgid "To test the HA of DHCP agent:" msgstr "DHCP エージェントの HA を試験するには以下のようにします。" msgid "" "Use the :command:`neutron ext-list` client command to check if these " "extensions are enabled. Check ``agent`` and ``agent_scheduler`` are included " "in the output." msgstr "" "これらの API 拡張が有効になっているかを確認するには :command:`neutron ext-" "list` コマンドを使用します。出力に ``agent`` と ``agent_scheduler`` が含まれ" "ていることを確認します。" "When you create a network with one port, the network will be scheduled to an " "active DHCP agent. If many active DHCP agents are running, select one " "randomly. You can design more sophisticated scheduling algorithms in the " "same way as nova-schedule later on." msgstr "" "ネットワークにポートを 1 つ作成すると、そのネットワークは稼働中の DHCP エー" "ジェントに割り当てられます。複数の稼働中のエージェントがある場合は、 1 つがラ" "ンダムに選択されます。 nova-scheduler と同様、もっと洗練されたスケジューリン" "グアルゴリズムを設計することもできるでしょう。" msgid """You can control the default number of DHCP agents assigned to a network by " "setting the following configuration option in the file ``/etc/neutron/" "neutron.conf``." msgstr "" "``/etc/neutron/neutron.conf`` ファイルの以下の設定オプションで、1 つのネット" "ワークに割り当てるデフォルトの DHCP エージェント数を制御できます。" msgid """You can request a specific subnet from the pool. You need to specify a " "subnet that falls within the pool's prefixes. If the subnet is not already " "allocated, the request succeeds. You can leave off the IP version because it " "is deduced from the subnet pool." msgstr "" "プールから特定のサブネットを割り当てることもできます。プールのプレフィックス" "内に収まるサブネットを指定する必要があります。サブネットがまだ割り当てられて" "いなければ、要求は成功します。サブネットプールから IP バージョンは推定できる" "ので、 IP バージョンの指定は省略できます。" msgid ""

subject: keystone: fix a race condition in bootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-18 18:03:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/a2157de58fd577ef9830288873f5e73a422dd643', 'message': "keystone: fix a race condition in bootstrap

Before, we had bootstrap_master set to 'undef' by default that was
used to whether or not run keystone bootstrap exec during deployment.

Setting the value to undef was a mistake, because enable_bootstrap in
puppet-keystone is set to true by default, so bootstrap was running
on all controllers at step 4 for HA scenario, while we want it to run on
a single controller (pacemaker_master) at step 4, like we do for
db-sync.

This patch:

* removes bootstrap_master.
* re-use sync_db to whether or not run keystone bootstrap.

commit_message:
keystone: fix a race condition in bootstrap

Before, we had bootstrap_master set to 'undef' by default that was
used to whether or not run keystone bootstrap exec during deployment.

Setting the value to undef was a mistake, because enable_bootstrap in
puppet-keystone is set to true by default, so bootstrap was running
on all controllers at step 4 for HA scenario, while we want it to run on
a single controller (pacemaker_master) at step 4, like we do for
db-sync.

This patch:

* removes bootstrap_master.
* re-use sync_db to whether or not run keystone bootstrap.
  so it will only run on a single node when database is ready and
  db-sync done (orchestration dones by anchors in puppet-keystone).

Change-Id: I1042862f7c346d1c358b908c33eae0f33afd5e9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/31/331431/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $sync_db = true, $manage_roles = true, $manage_endpoint = true, $manage_db_purge = hiera('keystone_enable_db_purge', true), $step = hiera('step'), enable_bootstrap => $sync_db,
deleted_lines: # [*bootstrap_master*] # (Optional) The hostname of the node responsible for bootstrapping # Defaults to hiera('bootstrap_nodeid') # $sync_db = true, $bootstrap_master = undef, $manage_roles = true, $manage_endpoint = true, $manage_db_purge = hiera('keystone_enable_db_purge', true), $step = hiera('step'), enable_bootstrap => $bootstrap_master,

commit_message:
Add scripts to run on fullstack CI job

These scripts are going to be used on the fullstack
networking-l2gw job.

Change-Id: I8961c3d940857d90c31cd14475ec3f71a739b213
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-l2gw refs/changes/98/326298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash set -xe NETWORKING_L2GW_DIR="$BASE/new/networking-l2gw" TEMPEST_DIR="$BASE/new/tempest" SCRIPTS_DIR="/usr/os-testr-env/bin/" venv=${1:-"fullstack"} function generate_test_logs { local path="$1" # Compress all $path/*.txt files and move the directories holding those # files to /opt/stack/logs. Files with .log suffix have their # suffix changed to .txt (so browsers will know to open the compressed # files and not download them). if [[ -d "$path" ]] ; then sudo find "$path" -iname "*.log" -type f -exec mv {} {}.txt \; -exec gzip -9 {}.txt \; sudo mv "$path/*" /opt/stack/logs/ fi } function generate_testr_results { # Give job user rights to access tox logs sudo -H -u "$owner" chmod o+rw . sudo -H -u "$owner" chmod o+rw -R .testrepository if [[ -f ".testrepository/0" ]] ; then ".tox/$venv/bin/subunit-1to2" < .testrepository/0 > ./testrepository.subunit $SCRIPTS_DIR/subunit2html ./testrepository.subunit testr_results.html gzip -9 ./testrepository.subunit gzip -9 ./testr_results.html sudo mv ./*.gz /opt/stack/logs/ fi if [[ "$venv" == fullstack* ]] ; then generate_test_logs "/tmp/${venv}-logs" fi } owner=stack sudo_env= # virtuelenv 14.0.6 gives a strange error which appears solved in version 15. # Therefore, we force the newer version. sudo pip uninstall -y virtualenv sudo pip install "virtualenv>=15.0.1" # Set owner permissions according to job's requirements. cd "$NETWORKING_L2GW_DIR" sudo chown -R $owner:stack "$NETWORKING_L2GW_DIR" # Run tests echo "Running networking-l2gw $venv tests" set +e sudo -H -u "$owner" tox -e "$venv" testr_exit_code=$? set -e # Collect and parse results generate_testr_results exit $testr_exit_code

This replaces dict.get(key) with dict[key] in
driver/modules/<vendor> unit tests, since we should
be explicit about whether we expect the key to exist or not.

In particular, we shouldn't be doing
    self.assertIsNone(dict.get(key))
since it will pass if 1. the value is None or 2. if the key isn't
in the dict.

Partial-Bug: #1590808

commit_message:
Replace dict.get(key) in drivers/modules/*/ tests

This replaces dict.get(key) with dict[key] in
driver/modules/<vendor> unit tests, since we should
be explicit about whether we expect the key to exist or not.

In particular, we shouldn't be doing
    self.assertIsNone(dict.get(key))
since it will pass if 1. the value is None or 2. if the key isn't
in the dict.

Change-Id: I1d0bc7d5b5561eab4317e47f2d7ef006f9e1cb1f
Partial-Bug: #1590808

commit_message:
Document testing an in-review patch with devstack

The method documented at
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/configuration.html#service-repos
doesn't work for services (like Ironic) that use a devstack plugin.
Documenting the right process to use should help new developers (who may
not be familiar with OpenStack infrastructure) become productive
quickly.

Change-Id: I40538306ea81dd356e47e063208ea1b84e6e9b24

commit_message:
Separate ubuntu-related providers to ubuntu14 and ubuntu16

refactor 'l23_os' fact and corresponded tests
create initial implementation of 'ubuntu16' providers

Change-Id: I750004af1ecdedd8da08036841877ef983bb0578
Related-bug: #1587084

commit_message:
Fix checking of hiera corosync_roles

Change-Id: Ic8285bda80db59bdf3cc5d64e4e62388f806f505
Closes-Bug:1573502
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/45/331145/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_keystone_nodes(nodes): hiera_hosts = [] for node in nodes: cmd = "cat /etc/hiera/plugins/detach-keystone.yaml" result = self.ssh_manager.execute_on_remote( ip=node['ip'], cmd=cmd, yamlify=True )['stdout_yaml'] hosts = result['corosync_roles'] logger.debug("hosts on {0} are {1}".format(node['hostname'], hosts)) if not hiera_hosts: hiera_hosts = hosts continue else: assert_true(set(hosts) == set(hiera_hosts), 'Hosts on node {0} differ from ' 'others'.format(node['hostname'])) check_keystone_nodes(keystone_nodes) check_keystone_nodes(keystone_nodes)
deleted_lines: checkers.check_hiera_hosts( keystone_nodes, cmd='hiera corosync_roles') checkers.check_hiera_hosts( keystone_nodes, cmd='hiera corosync_roles')

commit_message:
Use unversioned keystone endpoint in manifests

Murano use unversioned keystone endpoints since mitaka. This was not
considered during implementation of Fuel plugin.

Change-Id: I9b345a5ae5d1dfafbf3761107c66801fb4530c52

commit_message:
Look for a passing periodic upgrades job before moving pin

Now that the upgrades job is regularly passing we should look for
it to pass before moving the current-tripleo pin.

Change-Id: I5615cc163223f683730b15ee89b53081bd6783d0

commit_message:
Backport mysql OCF master choose/SST race fixes

* Fix MySQL RA OCF vars' local scopes
  (cherry picked from commit 0ba5fe8e77cedd552244dd33fe62c2f2147fa629)
* Fix SST check for MySQL OCF RA
  (cherry picked from commit c45eaa298549a2b03d1f3aead8ca92115c817f81)
* Fix possible masters eval
  (cherry picked from commit 958192b151c4a5cef3537eab0813307ea4cbb898)
* Fix mysql ocf sst in progress tracking
  (cherry picked from commit 7232dd03e16f448685066f360fec0b6b231d85e5)
* Fix a race for the xtrabackup-v2 SST
  (cherry picked from commit 3061ef0b584f9e43bc4f6139cf798558b77392ee)
* Prefer the wsrep-recover to get the GTID
  (cherry picked from commit 2c99cb0188ee4762d34bf8421c91ea0764cec389)
* Fix possible masters search
  (cherry picked from commit 685511ae2e42cb102c988b0f650723c57c073de5)
* MySQL OCF RA monitor to not race with SST in progress
  (cherry picked from commit 9442e58b945c073342e1f1410c09577df56c6e1f)
  Fix typo
  (cherry picked from commit 05f20dca018511861018afa84dd8d3873a2e2600)
* Ensure same node lists for possible masters search
  (cherry picked from commit d9b44f11a6eb6b83eab8785a0e66e4bf85f5ca1a)
* For OCF status, match mysqld by process id
  (cherry picked from commit 590a3f13f3fee83ae971e4c5d69d33a6487196d1)
* Fix mysqld process matching
  (cherry picked from commit 43fb2ba6fb59c21542ce21204262b72672a6ba70)
* Rework SST check, fix possible masters search
  (cherry picked from commit 03991059adcc99989431c27f38c5ffa4ae35b486)
* MySQL OCF RA to not chose all-zero-uuid as possible masters
  Related-bug: #1576244

commit_message:
Backport OCF/PAM security limits fixes

* Fix missing OCF logging
  (cherry picked from commit 6d90814c5675353aaf97946a40eb92d55cb9bdb4)
* Remove exit code verification from MySQL OCF
  (cherry picked from commit 14ec4750e763d82ab89f0b315f0d4f1341e893d6)
* Check for Mysql wss constraints among online nodes
  (cherry picked from commit 7050f07fe155e00fd1d3bcbf2658de56c3b25387)
* Refactor MySQL OCF script
  (cherry picked from commit 615a0428e3250cffadbf5ebf61e477e91858cb16)
* Update OCF stop actions to use procfs
  (cherry picked from commit 7c210ee68db112bbd16066a54bfdf462a8bbedbd)
* Fix the proc_kill ocf helper func
  (cherry picked from commit d961691e5fa7ba49305e35a4c17de09b2dae2eb6)
* Add pkill by name to the ocf-fuel-funcs
  (cherry picked from commit d5a370e8eb723dcfa28795b089d9f247f51ef105)
* Apply PAM security limits by running daemons through su
  (cherry picked from commit 65eca547606edceedc15d8fadfd1e5822ba9f1f6)

Backport mysql OCF master choose/SST race fixes

* Fix MySQL RA OCF vars' local scopes
  (cherry picked from commit 0ba5fe8e77cedd552244dd33fe62c2f2147fa629)
* Fix SST check for MySQL OCF RA
  (cherry picked from commit c45eaa298549a2b03d1f3aead8ca92115c817f81)
* Fix possible masters eval
  (cherry picked from commit 958192b151c4a5cef3537eab0813307ea4cbb898)
* Fix mysql ocf sst in progress tracking
  (cherry picked from commit 7232dd03e16f448685066f360fec0b6b231d85e5)
* Fix a race for the xtrabackup-v2 SST
  (cherry picked from commit 3061ef0b584f9e43bc4f6139cf798558b77392ee)
* Prefer the wsrep-recover to get the GTID
  (cherry picked from commit 2c99cb0188ee4762d34bf8421c91ea0764cec389)
* Fix possible masters search
  (cherry picked from commit 685511ae2e42cb102c988b0f650723c57c073de5)
* MySQL OCF RA monitor to not race with SST in progress
  (cherry picked from commit 9442e58b945c073342e1f1410c09577df56c6e1f)
  Fix typo
  (cherry picked from commit 05f20dca018511861018afa84dd8d3873a2e2600)
* Ensure same node lists for possible masters search
  (cherry picked from commit d9b44f11a6eb6b83eab8785a0e66e4bf85f5ca1a)
* For OCF status, match mysqld by process id
  (cherry picked from commit 590a3f13f3fee83ae971e4c5d69d33a6487196d1)
* Fix mysqld process matching
  (cherry picked from commit 43fb2ba6fb59c21542ce21204262b72672a6ba70)
* Rework SST check, fix possible masters search
  (cherry picked from commit 03991059adcc99989431c27f38c5ffa4ae35b486)
* MySQL OCF RA to not chose all-zero-uuid as possible masters
  Related-bug: #1576244
  (cherry picked from commit 52b12dab712e35b91eccab8190b48d4cdf80f52c)
* Fix OCF MySQL monitor
  Closes-bug: #1574999
  (cherry picked from commit dcde07f439b6f5a597c8fba1748fbebc151fe4a8)

Fuel-CI: disable

commit_message:
Backport mysql OCF master choose/SST race fixes

* Fix MySQL RA OCF vars' local scopes
  (cherry picked from commit 0ba5fe8e77cedd552244dd33fe62c2f2147fa629)
* Fix SST check for MySQL OCF RA
  (cherry picked from commit c45eaa298549a2b03d1f3aead8ca92115c817f81)
* Fix possible masters eval
  (cherry picked from commit 958192b151c4a5cef3537eab0813307ea4cbb898)
* Fix mysql ocf sst in progress tracking
  (cherry picked from commit 7232dd03e16f448685066f360fec0b6b231d85e5)
* Fix a race for the xtrabackup-v2 SST
  (cherry picked from commit 3061ef0b584f9e43bc4f6139cf798558b77392ee)
* Prefer the wsrep-recover to get the GTID
  (cherry picked from commit 2c99cb0188ee4762d34bf8421c91ea0764cec389)
* Fix possible masters search
  (cherry picked from commit 685511ae2e42cb102c988b0f650723c57c073de5)
* MySQL OCF RA monitor to not race with SST in progress
  (cherry picked from commit 9442e58b945c073342e1f1410c09577df56c6e1f)
  Fix typo
  (cherry picked from commit 05f20dca018511861018afa84dd8d3873a2e2600)
* Ensure same node lists for possible masters search
  (cherry picked from commit d9b44f11a6eb6b83eab8785a0e66e4bf85f5ca1a)
* For OCF status, match mysqld by process id
  (cherry picked from commit 590a3f13f3fee83ae971e4c5d69d33a6487196d1)
* Fix mysqld process matching
  (cherry picked from commit 43fb2ba6fb59c21542ce21204262b72672a6ba70)
* Rework SST check, fix possible masters search
  (cherry picked from commit 03991059adcc99989431c27f38c5ffa4ae35b486)
* MySQL OCF RA to not chose all-zero-uuid as possible masters
  Related-bug: #1576244
  (cherry picked from commit 52b12dab712e35b91eccab8190b48d4cdf80f52c)
* Fix OCF MySQL monitor
  Closes-bug: #1574999
  (cherry picked from commit dcde07f439b6f5a597c8fba1748fbebc151fe4a8)

Fuel-CI: disable

commit_message:
Backport OCF/PAM security limits fixes

* Fix missing OCF logging
  (cherry picked from commit 6d90814c5675353aaf97946a40eb92d55cb9bdb4)
* Remove exit code verification from MySQL OCF
  (cherry picked from commit 14ec4750e763d82ab89f0b315f0d4f1341e893d6)
* Check for Mysql wss constraints among online nodes
  (cherry picked from commit 7050f07fe155e00fd1d3bcbf2658de56c3b25387)
* Refactor MySQL OCF script
  (cherry picked from commit 615a0428e3250cffadbf5ebf61e477e91858cb16)
* Update OCF stop actions to use procfs
  (cherry picked from commit 7c210ee68db112bbd16066a54bfdf462a8bbedbd)
* Fix the proc_kill ocf helper func
  (cherry picked from commit d961691e5fa7ba49305e35a4c17de09b2dae2eb6)
* Add pkill by name to the ocf-fuel-funcs
  (cherry picked from commit d5a370e8eb723dcfa28795b089d9f247f51ef105)
* Apply PAM security limits by running daemons through su
  (cherry picked from commit 65eca547606edceedc15d8fadfd1e5822ba9f1f6)

Change-Id: Ie64b4d89c3e3b9aa360a4175416c866ed1ae2620
Closes-bug: #1487083

Closes-bug: #1524826
Closes-bug: #1542256
Partial-bug: #1425579
Closes-bug: #1528889
Partial-bug: #1532723
Closes-bug: #1429553
(cherry picked from commit aa7e4cc0829fed1206f0641822079ede3d1eaba6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/79/317979/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ocf_run_as_root ${COMMAND} ${OCF_RESKEY_extraconf} -u ntp:ntp -p "${PIDFILE}" -g -c ${CONF_FILE} if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then proc_stop "${PIDFILE}" "${OCF_RESKEY_binpath}" $shutdown_timeout
deleted_lines: ocf_run_as_root ${COMMAND} ${OCF_RESKEY_extraconf} -u ntp:ntp -p "${PIDFILE}" -4 -g -c "${CONF_FILE}" if [ "${?}" -ne "0" ]; then proc_stop "${PIDFILE}" "ntp" $shutdown_timeout

subject: Convert multiple exception types in the API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-20 06:38:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/df070aff5987fc9e0f23037bed590be2a0ecb747', 'message': "Convert multiple exception types in the API

The callback framework will collect all exceptions that occur
during the notification loop and raise a single exception
containing all of them. The issue with this is that the code
that notifies has to manually unpack the exceptions and choose
what to reraise for the API layer even if it has no other reason
to catch the exception (i.e. any encountered exceptions should be
fatal). If it doesn't, the server will just return a generic HTTP
500 error to the user even if the internal exception is a normal
error that would convert to a 404, 409, etc.

This patch makes the API exception conversion layer aware of
exceptions containing other exceptions so code no longer has to
catch callback failures if it has no specific error-handling logic.

Multiple exceptions that translate to the same HTTP error code will
be converted into one exception of the same error code with the
details of each exception line-separated in the exception message.

Multiple exceptions that translate to different HTTP error codes will
be concatenated together line-separated with their HTTP error prefixes
into an HTTP Conflict exception.

If there is only a single exception in the multi exception type, the
inner exception is used directly.

Partially-Implements: bp/multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I528de088079b68cf284ef361fee9bd195125e0d8

catch callback failures if it has no specific error-handling logic.

Multiple exceptions that translate to the same HTTP error code will
be converted into one exception of the same error code with the
details of each exception line-separated in the exception message.

Multiple exceptions that translate to different HTTP error codes will
be concatenated together line-separated with their HTTP error prefixes
into an HTTP Conflict exception.

If there is only a single exception in the multi exception type, the
inner exception is used directly.

Partially-Implements: bp/multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I528de088079b68cf284ef361fee9bd195125e0d8
"}]
commit_message:
Convert multiple exception types in the API

The callback framework will collect all exceptions that occur
during the notification loop and raise a single exception
containing all of them. The issue with this is that the code
that notifies has to manually unpack the exceptions and choose
what to reraise for the API layer even if it has no other reason
to catch the exception (i.e. any encountered exceptions should be
fatal). If it doesn't, the server will just return a generic HTTP
500 error to the user even if the internal exception is a normal
error that would convert to a 404, 409, etc.

This patch makes the API exception conversion layer aware of
exceptions containing other exceptions so code no longer has to
catch callback failures if it has no specific error-handling logic.

Multiple exceptions that translate to the same HTTP error code will
be converted into one exception of the same error code with the
details of each exception line-separated in the exception message.

Multiple exceptions that translate to different HTTP error codes will
be concatenated together line-separated with their HTTP error prefixes
into an HTTP Conflict exception.

If there is only a single exception in the multi exception type, the
inner exception is used directly.

Partially-Implements: bp/multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I528de088079b68cf284ef361fee9bd195125e0d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/73/319073/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import exceptions from oslo_serialization import jsonutilsfrom neutron.api.v2 import base as base_v2 from neutron.common import exceptions as n_excclass MultiException(n_exc.MultipleExceptions): def __init__(self, exceptions): self.exceptions = exceptions @property def inner_exceptions(self): return self.exceptions def test_convert_exception_to_http_exc_multiple_different_codes(self): e = MultiException([exceptions.NetworkInUse(net_id='nid'), exceptions.PortNotFound(port_id='pid')]) conv = common.convert_exception_to_http_exc(e, base_v2.FAULT_MAP, None) self.assertIsInstance(conv, exc.HTTPConflict) self.assertEqual( ("HTTP 409 NetworkInUse: Unable to complete operation on network " "nid. There are one or more ports still in use on the network.\n" "HTTP 404 PortNotFound: Port pid could not be found."), jsonutils.loads(conv.body)['NeutronError']['message']) def test_convert_exception_to_http_exc_multiple_same_codes(self): e = MultiException([exceptions.NetworkNotFound(net_id='nid'), exceptions.PortNotFound(port_id='pid')]) conv = common.convert_exception_to_http_exc(e, base_v2.FAULT_MAP, None) self.assertIsInstance(conv, exc.HTTPNotFound) self.assertEqual( "Network nid could not be found.\nPort pid could not be found.", jsonutils.loads(conv.body)['NeutronError']['message']) def test_convert_exception_to_http_exc_multiple_empty_inner(self): e = MultiException([]) conv = common.convert_exception_to_http_exc(e, base_v2.FAULT_MAP, None) self.assertIsInstance(conv, exc.HTTPInternalServerError)

commit_message:
libvirt: deprecate use_usb_tablet in favor of pointer_model

A new global option to handle input devices has
been introduced. The specifc option use_usb_tablet in the
group libvirt has been depecreated for Newton and should be
removed for O*

Related-To: blueprint virt-configure-usb-tablet-from-image
Change-Id: I51186530a94d86c8ed14783c7d42d0a3bd601f59

deleted_lines: return drvr._get_guest_usb_tablet(os_type)

commit_message:
Support for MultipleExceptions in db_api decorators

This adds support for checking for Deadlocks inside
of multiple exception types to the db api retry
mechanisms. This allows us to catch Deadlock errors
that occur inside of callbacks with uncaught exceptions.

Partially-Implements: bp/multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: I88fd45ee8ee694c6ae8c3e83ec7388953a65791e

subject: Fix config generated for rsyslog_client_log_files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-15 13:17:27.000000000', 'files': ['templates/99-rsyslog.conf.j2', 'tasks/rsyslog_client_post_install.yml', 'templates/os_aggregate_storage.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rsyslog_client/commit/6910847bceed4054d037eb317494654f1b2f12c3', 'message': 'Fix config generated for rsyslog_client_log_files

The rsyslog_client_log_files role variable was masked by the
rsyslog_client_log_files fact set during the post install task. This
caused the log files set in the rsyslog_client_log_files variable to be
ignored on the second or later invocation of the rsyslog_client role.
Instead the log files discovered from rsyslog_client_dir on previous
runs of the role were add to the list of logfiles. This resulted in
missing rsyslog configurations and duplicate logrotate entries.

Change-Id: I00a58def426a4f30f1e64a24320ee68157b95f24
'}]
commit_message:
Fix config generated for rsyslog_client_log_files

The rsyslog_client_log_files role variable was masked by the
rsyslog_client_log_files fact set during the post install task. This
caused the log files set in the rsyslog_client_log_files variable to be
ignored on the second or later invocation of the rsyslog_client role.
Instead the log files discovered from rsyslog_client_dir on previous
runs of the role were add to the list of logfiles. This resulted in
missing rsyslog configurations and duplicate logrotate entries.

Change-Id: I00a58def426a4f30f1e64a24320ee68157b95f24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rsyslog_client refs/changes/20/329920/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: {% for log_file in rsyslog_client_log_files %}

commit_message:
Use named interpolation instead of positional

Message with more than one variable use named interpolation
instead of positional. details information, please refer to
i18n guideline:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Closes-bug: #1592300

Change-Id: I22a565087c8907ce3f5d96d7fc417bc091dc02a3

commit_message:
Add Google Container Registry to KubernetesCluster

Allow access to Google Container Registry using json key as
a password for docker login. The key is scoped to a specific
Google Cloud Platform Console project and its resources.
Add new field for key.

Partially implements: blueprint k8s-google-registry-support

Change-Id: Ica71d1a48ac7fb75a71497fcbe318d1b9e4e8192

commit_message:
Add custom docker registry to KubernetesCluster

Allow access to private docker registry using docker argument
'--insecure-registry'.
Add new field for docker private registry host ip or domain name.

Partially implements: blueprint k8s-docker-enterprise-hub-support

Change-Id: I725c0b6a2bdbfe6eb9e627266411286fe44bfae3
(cherry picked from commit 5c5b44958d3868f3e7190ddc2cf5578a3c5b6716)

commit_message:
Use named interpolation instead of positional

Message with more than one variable use named interpolation
instead of positional. details information, please refer to
i18n guideline:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Closes-bug: #1592300

Change-Id: I95dba186c27781bf15a191888f0fb54f296f44af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/74/329774/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise AttributeError( "The connection handler %(possible_handler)s " "could not be found on %(cls)s.", { 'possible_handler': possible_handler, 'cls': cls }) raise ValueError( "Importing a local function as a string is not " "supported for the connection handler " "%(possible_handler)s on %(cls)s.", { 'possible_handler': possible_handler, 'cls': cls }) raise ImportError( "Could not import %(bits)s from the module " "%(module_name)s as a connection handler " "on %(cls)s.", { 'bits': bits[-1], 'module_name': module_name,'cls': cls }) except AttributeError: raise AttributeError( "Could not import %(bits)s from the module " "%(module_name)s as a connection handler " "on %(cls)s.", { 'bits': bits[-1], 'module_name': module_name,'cls': cls }) raise exceptions.WorkflowError( "The following expected data was not added to the workflow " "context by the step %(class)s: %(contribute)s.", { 'class': self.__class__, 'contribute': failed_to_contribute })
deleted_lines: raise AttributeError("The connection handler %s " "could not be found on %s." % (possible_handler, cls)) raise ValueError("Importing a local function as a string " "is not supported for the connection " "handler %s on %s." % (possible_handler, cls)) raise ImportError("Could not import %s from the " "module %s as a connection " "handler on %s." % (bits[-1], module_name, cls)) except AttributeError: raise AttributeError("Could not import %s from the " "module %s as a connection " "handler on %s." % (bits[-1], module_name, cls)) raise exceptions.WorkflowError("The following expected data was " "not added to the workflow context " "by the step %s: %s." % (self.__class__, failed_to_contribute))

subject: Add set_inventory() method on ResourceProvider
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-07 12:52:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a1060a335d00f2c646fa6ea1b5ef6cd13f6a9886', 'message': "Add set_inventory() method on ResourceProvider

Adds a set_inventory() method on the ResourceProvider object that
replaces the resource provider's inventory with a supplied set of
inventory records in an InventoryList object. The replacement is done in
a consistent fashion using the resource provider's generation value to
ensure that a writer doesn't update the inventory of a resource provider
after another writer has changed the inventory in between the original
read of inventory information and the subsequent save of that inventory.

Change-Id: I2214fa5d176269e65fdcd7a5a7e4958a925235d3
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-07 13:45:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c10093af3f7b562751bec281f06d202951d18979', 'message': "Add set_inventory() method on ResourceProvider

Adds a set_inventory() method on the ResourceProvider object that
replaces the resource provider's inventory with a supplied set of
inventory records in an InventoryList object. The replacement is done in
a consistent fashion using the resource provider's generation value to
ensure that a writer doesn't update the inventory of a resource provider
after another writer has changed the inventory in between the original
read of inventory information and the subsequent save of that inventory.

This needs some additional work before it is complete:

* a patch before it which adds generation on ResourceProvider
* moving a functional test to functional
* determining the way in which 'generation' is supposed to enter the
  picture from outside the object.

Partially-Implements: generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I2214fa5d176269e65fdcd7a5a7e4958a925235d3

"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-06-08 10:58:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5b1e298407c7f1fecfbfb569f857d0d0bb17eac7', 'message': "Add set_inventory() method on ResourceProvider

Adds a set_inventory() method on the ResourceProvider object that
replaces the resource provider's inventory with a supplied set of
inventory records in an InventoryList object. The replacement is done in
a consistent fashion using the resource provider's generation value to
ensure that a writer doesn't update the inventory of a resource provider
after another writer has changed the inventory in between the original
read of inventory information and the subsequent save of that inventory.

A functional test is in place which attempts to exercise all three
of add, delete and update inventory as well as causing a
ConcurrentUpdateException. That test exposed two areas that need
additional work/discussion:

* When set_inventory updates the generation on disk, it seems like
  it should probably be setting rp.generation to the new value and
  resetting the object, otherwise the caller's picture of the object
  state is no longer accurate.
* What should the message associated with ConcurrentUpdateException
  be? Should it subclass to ResourceProviderConcurrent.. and
  Inventory.. and Allocation.. ?

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I2214fa5d176269e65fdcd7a5a7e4958a925235d3
"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2016-06-08 17:29:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6995f8bef5f9830be398c78779e1be0f6b52b43c', 'message': "Add set_inventory() method on ResourceProvider

commit_message:
Add set_inventory() method on ResourceProvider

Adds a set_inventory() method on the ResourceProvider object that
replaces the resource provider's inventory with a supplied set of
inventory records in an InventoryList object. The replacement is done in
a consistent fashion using the resource provider's generation value to
ensure that a writer doesn't update the inventory of a resource provider
after another writer has changed the inventory in between the original
read of inventory information and the subsequent save of that inventory.

A functional test is in place which attempts to exercise all three
of add, delete and update inventory as well as causing a
ConcurrentUpdateException.

The object hash has changed but no version increment done because
the ResourceProvider object is not yet in use in the wild. These
changes are still bringing the eventual first version to its correct
form.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
Change-Id: I2214fa5d176269e65fdcd7a5a7e4958a925235d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/326440/22 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _make_inventory(context): db_rp = objects.ResourceProvider( context=context, uuid=uuids.inventory_resource_provider) db_rp.create() updates = dict(_INVENTORY_DB, resource_provider_id=db_rp.id) updates.pop('id') db_inventory = objects.Inventory._create_in_db( context, updates) return db_rp, db_inventory # TODO(jaypipes): This is a functional test, not a unit test and belongs in # the functional test suite... def test_provider_set_inventory(self): rp = objects.ResourceProvider(context=self.context, uuid=_RESOURCE_PROVIDER_UUID) disk_inv = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=rp, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, total=1024, reserved=15, min_unit=10, max_unit=100, step_size=10, allocation_ration=1.0) vcpu_inv = objects.Inventory( resource_provider=rp, resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, total=12, reserved=0, min_unit=1, max_unit=12, step_size=1, allocation_ration=16.0) inv_list = objects.InventoryList(objects=[disk_inv, vcpu_inv]) rp.set_inventory(inv_list) new_inv_list = objects.InventoryList.get_by_resource_provider_uuid( _RESOURCE_PROVIDER_UUID) self.assertEqual(2, len(new_inv_list)) db_rp, db_inventory = _make_inventory(self.context) db_rp, db_inventory = _make_inventory(self.context) db_rp, db_inventory = _make_inventory(self.context)
deleted_lines: def _make_inventory(self): db_rp = objects.ResourceProvider( context=self.context, uuid=uuids.inventory_resource_provider) db_rp.create() updates = dict(_INVENTORY_DB, resource_provider_id=db_rp.id) updates.pop('id') db_inventory = objects.Inventory._create_in_db( self.context, updates) return db_rp, db_inventory db_rp, db_inventory = self._make_inventory() db_rp, db_inventory = self._make_inventory() db_rp, db_inventory = self._make_inventory()

added_lines: - ``os_secure_boot`` - Secure Boot is a security standard developed by members of the PC industry to help make sure that your PC boots using only software that is trusted by the PC manufacturer. When the PC starts, the firmware checks the signature of each piece of boot software, including firmware drivers (Option ROMs) and the operating system. If the signatures are good, the PC boots, and the firmware gives control to the operating system. - * ``required`` - Enabled the Secure Boot feature. * ``disabled or optional`` - (default) Disable the Secure Boot feature. * - All

commit_message:
Use the correct action for failure reason

Use `action` from ResourceFailure exception, if available, as
there are cases like update restriction check, where we don't
update the resource action yet.

Change-Id: I5d43c220669c7a9e8d7dbce6611e062101f8b86b
Closes-Bug: #1592631

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-17 09:03:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/ac710e744b9224b77fbec8a7074d1ee595bd19b9', 'message': 'Update all SHAs for 12.0.16

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

Additional updated include:
- The get-pypi-pkg-version script is set to use https instead of
  http.
- The ansible-role-requirements-editor.py script is added to facilitate
  automated updates of the ansible-role-requirements file.
- The sources-branch-updater is updated to automate the updates to
  ansible-role-requirements, and to automatically increment the release
  version.

Change-Id: Ib6cc4703192cda7c9dce662a70d1e0e1bbcb6e4c
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-17 12:19:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/fb9725abe67d08dd59ebdf7cd02fca44681d2a4a', 'message': 'Update all SHAs for 12.0.16

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

Additional updated include:
- The get-pypi-pkg-version script is set to use https instead of
  http.
- The ansible-role-requirements-editor.py script is added to facilitate
  automated updates of the ansible-role-requirements file.
- The sources-branch-updater is updated to automate the updates to
  ansible-role-requirements, and to automatically increment the release
  version.
- The test-requirements are updated to match the current master
  requirements from the OpenStack requirements repository using
  global-requirements

Change-Id: Ib6cc4703192cda7c9dce662a70d1e0e1bbcb6e4c
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-17 12:29:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/0b096a5d9ae51f6dae0105254e18bb1897b7c56f', 'message': 'Update all SHAs for 12.0.16

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

Additional updated include:
- The get-pypi-pkg-version script is set to use https instead of
  http.
- The ansible-role-requirements-editor.py script is added to facilitate
  automated updates of the ansible-role-requirements file.
- The sources-branch-updater is updated to automate the updates to
  ansible-role-requirements, and to automatically increment the release
  version.
- The test-requirements are updated to match the current stable/liberty
  requirements from the OpenStack requirements repository using

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 12.0.16

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

Additional updated include:
- The get-pypi-pkg-version script is set to use https instead of
  http.
- The ansible-role-requirements-editor.py script is added to facilitate
  automated updates of the ansible-role-requirements file.
- The sources-branch-updater is updated to automate the updates to
  ansible-role-requirements, and to automatically increment the release
  version.
- The test-requirements are updated to match the current stable/liberty
  requirements from the OpenStack requirements repository using
  global-requirements

Change-Id: Ib6cc4703192cda7c9dce662a70d1e0e1bbcb6e4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/60/330960/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - The dictionary-based variables in ``defaults/main.yml`` are now individual variables. The dictionary-based variables could not be changed as the documentation instructed. Instead it was required to override the entire dictionary. Deployers must use the new variable names to enable or disable the security configuration changes applied by the security role. For more information, see `Launchpad Bug 1577944 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1577944>`_.

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.1.4

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Additional updated include:
- The Ironic git source repository name is updated to os_ironic
  and set to use git.openstack.org
- The get-pypi-pkg-version script is set to use https instead of
  http
- The sources-branch-updater script is changed to remove the
  workaround for the Ironic repo name mismatch
- The test-requirements are updated to match the current
  stable/mitaka requirements from the OpenStack requirements
  repository using global-requirements
- Sets the sources-branch-updater to use the branch/topic
  'sha-update' when updating the files/templates in each role
  repository.

Change-Id: I9da9f3924484c2a27b280e0cab01f515e37fd57b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/41/330941/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - The role previously did not restart the audit daemon after generating a new rules file. The `bug <https://launchpad.net/bugs/1590916>`_ has been fixed and the audit daemon will be restarted after any audit rule changes.

commit_message:
Only match full IP addresses in /etc/hosts

Include the space in after the IP address in the match string to avoid
matching IP addreses which only differ in an addtional digit at the end.
With the previous logic an entry for 10.1.1.1 would also delete entries
for 10.1.1.12 or 10.1.1.123.

Change-Id: I797ff261630f4115b3852138c19eb039303e27c6
(cherry picked from commit 90237b043fa69de3e7a35262fe6bdfba5c449e9a)

deleted_lines: sed -i '/^{{ hostvars[item]["ansible_ssh_host"] }}.*/d' /etc/hosts

Clean up container cache prep in tests

This patch cleans up the container cache preparation in the tests
due to the following patches:

- https://review.openstack.org/307856 (new image build process)
- https://review.openstack.org/315114 (new apt config process)
- https://review.openstack.org/322188 (new resolver config process)

commit_message:
Reload systemd after installing rabbitmq

To ensure that the rabbitmq-server service is registered, reload the
systemd daemon after installing the rabbitmq package.

commit_message:
Refactor pip_install to support offline deployment

Optionally support the download and installation of pip and its dependencies
via the deployment host to remove the dependence of internet connectivity on
remote containers.

When pip_offline_install is true, download get-pip.py and the pip
installation wheels to the deployment host. These wheels along with get-pip.py
are copied to the remote container and the installation is performed
offline.

Change-Id: Ic6583c54976b6fb083d9c67d055897c15bce05dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install refs/changes/07/274407/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-16 09:29:41.000000000', 'files': ['templates/openstack-host-hostfile-setup.sh.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/commit/ffbb9fbace4bd1d0fd21a3284bd08155639b02ee', 'message': 'Only match full IP addresses in /etc/hosts

Include the space in after the IP address in the match string to avoid
matching IP addreses which only differ in an addtional digit at the end.
With the previous logic an entry for 10.1.1.1 would also delete entries
for 10.1.1.12 or 10.1.1.123.

(cherry picked from commit 90237b043fa69de3e7a35262fe6bdfba5c449e9a)
'}]
commit_message:
Only match full IP addresses in /etc/hosts

Include the space in after the IP address in the match string to avoid
matching IP addreses which only differ in an addtional digit at the end.
With the previous logic an entry for 10.1.1.1 would also delete entries
for 10.1.1.12 or 10.1.1.123.

Change-Id: I797ff261630f4115b3852138c19eb039303e27c6
(cherry picked from commit 90237b043fa69de3e7a35262fe6bdfba5c449e9a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/02/330402/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: sed -i '/^{{ hostvars[item]["ansible_ssh_host"] }}.*/d' /etc/hosts

commit_message:
Mark several cleanup resources as tenant_resource

Nova servers and security groups are tenant related resources,
but resource decorator missed that fact which makes cleanup
tries to delete one resources several times.

Change-Id: Ie3a0a40c2282fc7cffa33f1efe5d37601a461709
Closes-Bug: #1584104
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/89/329989/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: @base.resource("nova", "servers", order=next(_nova_order))@base.resource("nova", "security_groups", order=next(_nova_order))

commit_message:
3PAR driver failure SR License missing in array

This patch performs check if the array supports System Reporter and
depending on this license, performs call to _update_volume_stats()
at initialization.
Added unit test to verify get_volume_stats() when SR lic missing

Closes-Bug: #1568078
(cherry picked from commit 125a900815684b973788cc7a3c9d9ed8232cc2c4)

Change-Id: Ifb1bb4552254ed1e790600fab80fcc7aa76b8a38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/27/330227/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 3.0.19 - Driver no longer fails to initialize if System Reporter license is missing. bug #1568078 VERSION = "3.0.19" SYSTEM_REPORTER_LIC = "System Reporter" sr_support = True sr_support = self._check_license_enabled( valid_licenses, self.SYSTEM_REPORTER_LIC, "System_reporter_support") stat_capabilities = { THROUGHPUT: None, BANDWIDTH: None, LATENCY: None, IO_SIZE: None, QUEUE_LENGTH: None, AVG_BUSY_PERC: None } if (self.API_VERSION >= SRSTATLD_API_VERSION and sr_support): try: stat_capabilities = self.client.getCPGStatData( cpg_name, interval, history) except Exception as ex: LOG.warning(_LW("Exception at getCPGStatData() " "for cpg: '%(cpg_name)s' " "Reason: '%(reason)s'") % {'cpg_name': cpg_name, 'reason': ex})
deleted_lines: VERSION = "3.0.18.1" if (self.API_VERSION >= SRSTATLD_API_VERSION): stat_capabilities = self.client.getCPGStatData(cpg_name, interval, history) else: stat_capabilities = { THROUGHPUT: None, BANDWIDTH: None, LATENCY: None, IO_SIZE: None, QUEUE_LENGTH: None, AVG_BUSY_PERC: None }

" "Обеспечивает работу с ядрами с ограниченной поддержкой пространств имен, " "например, в RHEL 6.5, если ovs_use_veth задан равным True."msgstr "Пароль идентификации VRRP"msgstr "Тип идентификации VRRP"msgstr "Сеть VXLAN не поддерживается."msgstr "Значение %(value)s в отображении '%(mapping)s' не уникально""Значение %(parameter)s должно быть кратным %(number)s, при этом максимальное " "значение - %(maximum)s и минимальное - %(minimum)s""Частота отсчетов времени в ядре (в Гц) для вычисления минимального значения " "пакета в правилах ограничения пропускной способности канала для порта с QoS. " "За дополнительной информацией обратитесь к описанию параметра ядра HZ и " "руководству по tc-tbf.""Задержка в миллисекундах для вычисления размера очереди для порта с QoS. За " "дополнительной информацией обратитесь к руководству по tc-tbf.""Отслеживать протокол. Отслеживание протокола должно быть выключено, когда " "metadata_proxy_user/group не имеет прав доступа на чтение/запись файла " "протокола прокси метаданных. ""Если задана опция external_network_bridge, то каждый агент L3 может быть " "связан не более чем с одной внешней сетью. Присвойте опции значение UUID " "этой внешней сети. Для того чтобы агент L3 поддерживал несколько внешних " "сетей, оба параметра, external_network_bridge и gateway_external_network_id, " "должны быть пустыми.""При проксировании запросов метаданных Neutron подписывает заголовок Instance-" "ID общим секретным ключом для предотвращения подмены. Ключом может быть " "любая строка, но она должна совпадать с указанной в конфигурации для сервера " "метаданных Nova. Примечание: Nova использует тот же ключ конфигурации, но в " "разделе [neutron].""Расположение хранения файлов состояния Neutron. Этот каталог должен быть " "доступен для записи агентом.""При использовании IPv6 применяемой для внешнего шлюза сети не обязательно " "иметь связанную подсеть, так как может быть использован автоматически " "назначаемый адрес link-local (LLA). Однако, адрес шлюза IPv6 необходим в " "качестве следующего узла для маршрута по умолчанию. Если адрес шлюза IPv6 не " "указан здесь, (и только в этом случае) будет настроен маршрутизатор Neutron " "для получения маршрута по умолчанию из объявлений маршрутизатора (RA) от " "маршрутизатора выше по течению. В этом случае маршрутизатор выше по течению " "должен быть также настроен для отправки этих RA. Когда указано значение " "ipv6_gateway, оно должно указывать на LLA интерфейса маршрутизатора выше по " "течению. Если следующий узел, использующийглобальный уникальный адрес (GUA), " "является предпочитаем, это необходимо обеспечить посредством подсети, " "выделенной для сети, а не с помощью этого параметра. "msgstr "Отсутствует реализация __call__""Необходимо задать файл конфигурации для моста, или --config-file, или " "env[NEUTRON_TEST_CONFIG_FILE]"msgstr "Необходимо указать ревизию или относительную дельта"msgstr "пул подсетей должен быть указан в отсутствие cidr"msgstr "add_ha_port нельзя вызывать внутри транзакции."msgstr "allocation_pools разрешено только для определенных запросов подсетей. "msgstr "allocation_pools не принадлежит подсети"msgstr "Недопустимая версия IP для allocation_pools"msgstr "атрибут уже является синтетическим"msgstr "Слишком большое значение binding:profile"msgstr "не удается выполнить %(event)s, причина: %(reason)s"msgstr "cidr и prefixlen не должны быть указаны вместе""Значение dhcp_agents_per_network должно быть >= 1. Значение '%s' недопустимо."msgstr "dns_domain должен указываться вместе с dns_name"msgstr "dns_name должен указываться вместе с dns_domain"msgstr "fixed_ip_address должен указываться вместе с port_id"msgstr "имеет владельца устройства %s"msgstr "Используется"msgstr "Не удалось выполнить команду ip на устройстве %(dev_name)s: %(reason)s"msgstr "Команда ip не выполнена: %(reason)s"msgstr "Функция ip link %(capability)s не поддерживается"msgstr "Команда ip link не поддерживается: %(reason)s"msgstr "ip_version должно быть указано при отсутствии cidr and subnetpool_id"msgstr "ipv6_address_mode недопустим, когда ip_version - 4"msgstr "ipv6_ra_mode недопустим, когда ip_version - 4""Невозможно задать ipv6_ra_mode или ipv6_address_mode, если для enable_dhcp " "задано значение False.""Для ipv6_ra_mode задано значение '%(ra_mode)s', а значение " "ipv6_address_mode, заданное как '%(addr_mode)s', является недопустимым. Если " "указаны оба атрибута, их значения должны совпадать"msgstr "Обновление mac-адреса""Недопустимый параметр конфигурации max_l3_agents_per_router %(max_agents)s. " "Он должен быть больше либо равен min_l3_agents_per_router %(min_agents)s.""Недопустимый параметр конфигурации min_l3_agents_per_router. Он должен быть " "не меньше %s для высокой готовности."msgstr "Необходимо задать ровно 2 аргумента - cidr и MAC"msgstr "Требуется network_type"msgstr "Для network_type не поддерживается значение '%s'"msgstr "новая подсеть"msgstr "Неизвестная физическая сеть '%s' для сети VLAN провайдера"msgstr "Неизвестная физическая сеть '%s' для одноуровневой сети провайдера"msgstr "Для одноуровневой сети провайдера требуется physical_network"msgstr "Для сети %s указан provider:physical_network"msgstr "rbac_db_model не найден в %s"msgstr "запись"msgstr "Значение respawn_interval, если оно указано, должно быть >= 0."msgstr "segmentation_id вне диапазона (%(min)s - %(max)s)""Для segmentation_id требуется physical_network для сети VLAN провайдера"msgstr "общий атрибут изменен на синтетический""Пул подсетей %(subnetpool_id)s нельзя изменять, если он связан с " "общедоступной адресной областью %(address_scope_id)s""Нельзя одновременно задавать значения subnetpool_id и use_default_subnetpool"msgstr "следующий узел не соединен с маршрутизатором"msgstr "следующий узел используется маршрутизатором"msgstr "не удалось загрузить %s""UUID передан из командной строки. Это позволяет внешнему процессу " "отслеживать через интерфейс /proc/cmdline."

commit_message:
Add README for api-ref

In the neutron stadium, we maintain the networking API reference
in neutron-lib repository. It is different from other projects,
so it would be helpful for contributors if we have README in the
usual location (neutron/api-ref).

Depends-On: I6f2c4d476c31b252bfb181138505673f397639fc
Change-Id: I41dc58e5edfd18a52f13f042ba865b82fad764f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/19/314819/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. -*- rst -*- ========== Extensions ========== Lists available Networking API v2.0 extensions and shows details for an extension. List extensions =============== .. rest_method:: GET /v2.0/extensions Lists available extensions. Extensions introduce features and vendor-specific functionality to the API. The response shows the extension name and its alias. To show details for an extension, you specify the alias. Normal response codes: 200 Error response codes:203, Request ------- Response Parameters ------------------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - updated: updated - description: description - links: links - alias: alias - extension: extension - name: name Response Example ---------------- .. literalinclude:: ../samples/extensions/extensions-list-response.json :language: javascript Show extension details ====================== .. rest_method:: GET /v2.0/extensions/{alias} Shows details for an extension, by alias. Normal response codes: 200 Error response codes:203, Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - alias: alias Response Parameters ------------------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - updated: updated - description: description - links: links - alias: alias - extension: extension - name: name Response Example ---------------- .. literalinclude:: ../samples/extensions/extension-show-response.json :language: javascript

commit_message:
IBM FlashSystem: Add host check for iSCSI driver

If host was deleted by others, the deleted host still exist in hosts.
In _find_host_exhaustive(), all hosts would been enumerated. Thus, if no
host exists in FlashSystem, 'lshost' command will failed. But if other
host(s) exists, wrong host will be returned.

In this fix,
* Add hostname check before issue 'lshost' command for iSCSI.
* Bump version to 1.0.10.

Change-Id: Ic7c7b397293102e864adcbe78770b3a620e2f72a
Close-bug: 1585085

commit_message:
Fix shell command usage

In https://review.openstack.org/320624 a method of providing the
shell module arguments was used which breaks ansible-lint (and
is improper anyway). The lint check did not effectively catch
this. The lint check not working will be resolved in another
patch. This patch fixes the task's syntax to ensure that fixed
lint checks implemented in other repositories do not fail on
this role.

Change-Id: If62fed46937193c0868ca2c9d2b4c29bfd331c59

commit_message:
Enable libvirt as a micro-service

Deploy compute nodes using both libvirt & nova-compute profiles, both
ready for micro-services.

Note: a future iteration will deploy nova-compute libvirt parameters
like we do with Neutron plugins, so we'll be able to easily plug other
backends (VMware, etc). Until then default the nova-compute service to
use libvirt.

Change-Id: I7461b01fdb96be59c8e0c55c21882d86582e54d0
Depends-On: I2ff3cf6a31bc10aa46a089fcbfc654eda55e6ef8
Depends-On: I1a1cb827512b12289558b296a7e64ce2dc71f00a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/18/329718/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

  self.assertIn(value, list)

commit_message:
Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: Ic2461afd9872767fe615064610daffb52e743388
Closes-Bug: #1510007
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/74/330474/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.assertTrue('ironic_object.changes' in primitive) self.assertFalse('foo' in obj) self.assertTrue('foo' in obj) self.assertFalse('does_not_exist' in obj) self.assertTrue('ironic_object.name' in primitive)

commit_message:
Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: I2d1c78fe71fe03e350b1035123b0a48b7186a6ec
Closes-Bug: #1510007

subject: Generic PCI Resource spec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 10:49:53.000000000', 'files': ['specs/backlog/generic-pci-resource.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs/commit/9de0d419c8c7eea75b8ca488e4d5f0326da0d56b', 'message': 'Generic PCI Resource spec

Change-Id: I7aa51595f8095bf9d6a070b477dfb9c8845b4d00
'}]
commit_message:
Generic PCI Resource spec

Change-Id: I7aa51595f8095bf9d6a070b477dfb9c8845b4d00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/14/285214/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================== Generic PCI Resource ==================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1550275 Currently, the iLO driver sets a GPU resource capability by hardware inspection (namely pci_gpu_devices [#]_). In this spec, we want to propose a more generic implementation of hardware inspection and updating the node capabilities. The name of the capability, as well as the PCI vendor and device ID list will be configured by the deployer. After creating a corresponding flavor, nova scheduler can filter nodes by flavor's extra_specs for a wide range of PCI device types. Problem description =================== Some workloads may require presence of specific hardware. An example of this can be an image flavor, which requires a minimal set of hardware accelerators to be present in order to be effective. Another flavor may require a different accelerator in a differing quantity. The HP iLO driver supports updating the capability list with a number of present GPUs, which demonstrates, that the feature is in demand for customers using that specific hardware. A more general support of various hardware is also in demand, to accommodate new solutions, which are entering the market [#]_. Proposed change =============== The proposed change is to implement a collector of PCI devices in the ironic-python-agent inspector module, which will return a full list of PCI devices to ironic inspector. The second part of the change is to write an ironic inspector plugin, which updates nodes with configured properties for use by the nova scheduler. The ironic-inspector configuration will include a list of capability names with their corresponding vendor and device IDs. Each defined capability will behave the same way as the pci_gpu_devices capability in the iLO driver. The capabilities are then read by nova scheduler and used for filtering, by matching against flavor's extra_specs. Alternatives ------------ One alternative is to use the iLO driver, which supports pci_gpu_devices extra capability, but it doesn't support other PCI devices. Another alternative is to manually update the node capabilities, without the ironic-inspector. This may be a valid solution if all instances of the new hardware are configured in the same way. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: xek Other contributors: szymon-borkowski Work Items ---------- * create a tooling module for listing PCI devices * implement a collector of PCI devices in ironic-python-agent inspector module * implement an ironic inspector plugin, which updates node properties with configured PCI resource capabilities for use by nova scheduler * document the new feature References ========== .. [#] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/drivers/ilo.html#hardware-inspection-support .. [#] http://ark.intel.com/products/87380/Intel-Visual-Compute-Accelerator

commit_message:
Always execute Nova virt type detection

This fix executes the nova virt type detection on any playbook run
and will eliminate the need to specify the nova-cpuinfo-read,
nova-virt-type-set tags along with the intended tag like nova-config.

Change-Id: Ic34011149f1355cfa48f4ee35537362e2d24e55d
Closes-Bug: #1587452
(cherry picked from commit a8d1e412ef8af4ac345c5f926e37b741aa7a1adb)

[config-ref] add Compute cell scheduling filters

backport: mitaka liberty

Change-Id: Idbf3190319ab04c172dac41b66296b47c7ea1043
Closes-Bug: #1538292
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/93/331393/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _compute-scheduler-filters: Compute filters ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The following sections describe the available compute filters.Cell filters ~~~~~~~~~~~~ The following sections describe the available cell filters. DifferentCellFilter ------------------- Schedules the instance on a different cell from a set of instances. To take advantage of this filter, the requester must pass a scheduler hint, using ``different_cell`` as the key and a list of instance UUIDs as the value. ImagePropertiesFilter --------------------- Filters cells based on properties defined on the instance’s image. This filter works specifying the hypervisor required in the image metadata and the supported hypervisor version in cell capabilities. TargetCellFilter ---------------- Filters target cells. This filter works by specifying a scheduler hint of ``target_cell``. The value should be the full cell path.
deleted_lines: .. _compute-scheduler-filters: Filters ~~~~~~~ The following sections describe the available filters.

commit_message:
Pecan: handle single fields query parameter

This also correctly handles the case where no fields are requested which seems
to have started to break.

Closes-Bug: #1590588
Change-Id: Ida1e3ff575c7fe6c3199c5f4393679bbf89c0fe1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/94/327394/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fields = kwargs.pop('fields', []) # if only one fields query parameter is passed, pecan will put that # parameter in a list, so we need to convert it into a list if not isinstance(fields, list): fields = [fields] fields = self._build_field_list(fields)
deleted_lines: fields = self._build_field_list(kwargs.pop('fields', []))

commit_message:
Address FutureWarning for invalid UUIDs

Ensure that the following warning does not appear in the tests:

    FutureWarning: test-tenant is an invalid UUID. Using
    UUIDFields with invalid UUIDs is no longer supported,
    and will be removed in a future release. Please update
    your code to input valid UUIDs or accept ValueErrors
    for invalid UUIDs. See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField
    for further details

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie34627380526734e3d6895859e7805f3023ddc78

commit_message:
adopt neutron_lib for constants and exceptions

Neutron-lib decomposition[1] effort moves constants and exceptions
from neutron to neutron-lib. In Newton cycle, those will be
eliminated from neutron repo. and neutron stadium evolution[2]
requires networking-odl to use neutron-lib.
This patch makes use of neutron_lib for constants and exceptions
instead of neutron ones.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/liberty/neutron-lib.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/neutron-stadium.html

Change-Id: I255652cb029a66ba22ccdc71332e5884783bcc2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/15/329615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import constants as n_constants
deleted_lines: from neutron.common import constants as n_constants

commit_message:
Add sync_all process into v2 driver init

This is the first patch, which verify the the ODL cold reboot detection
when init and implement the basic resource sync function. Thread pool
implementaion will not be included.

This patch introduces a new table opendaylightsync which works as a
state machine/lock to trigger the actual sync process in journal thread
by monitor thread.

Change-Id: I028b39490fc6a994e5ee7a723de502f62ccbc814
Close-Bug: #1540205

commit_message:
Address Ansible bare variable usage

When executing the role with Ansible 2.1, the following
deprecation warning is issued in the output for some tasks.

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using bare variables is deprecated.

This patch addresses the tasks to fix the behaviour appropriately.

Change-Id: I8ccbeca6b9aa869cb87a7219feff1a2715efa9c6

subject: Compute IPAvailabilityRanges in memory during IP allocation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-14 05:19:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e6e3576a9324f0964320e47a0b9de6f34f23ed8e', 'message': 'Compute IPAvailabilityRanges in memory during IP allocation

This patch computes IP availability in memory without locking on
IPAvailabilityRanges. IP availability is generated in memory, and
to avoid contention an IP address is selected by randomly
selecting from within the first 10 available IP addresses on a
subnet. Raise a RetryRequest if unable to allocate an IP address
from within the window.

This patch is a work-in-progress and is meant to illustrate an
alternate approach to addressing bug 1543094. This will induce
some unit test failures that assert a more deterministic way
of allocating IP addresses and more work is needed to get them
fixed up.

Change-Id: I52e4485e832cbe6798de6b4afb6a7cfd88db11e2
Closes-Bug: #1543094
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-05 22:05:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/94f925230373d8bb1337ca2e33b77e40b95fe12d', 'message': 'Compute IPAvailabilityRanges in memory during IP allocation

commit_message:
Compute IPAvailabilityRanges in memory during IP allocation

This patch computes IP availability in memory without locking on
IPAvailabilityRanges. IP availability is generated in memory, and
to avoid contention an IP address is selected by randomly
selecting from within the first 10 available IP addresses on a
subnet. Raises IPAddressGenerationFailure if unable to allocate an
IP address from within the window.

Change-Id: I52e4485e832cbe6798de6b4afb6a7cfd88db11e2
Depends-On: I84195b0eb63b7ca6a4e00becbe09e579ff8b718e
Closes-Bug: #1543094

First, the nullable attribute on port_id was redundant because it is
in the primary key.

Second, trunk_id shouldn't be in the primary key.  Since port_id was
already marked unique, it didn't add any extra uniqueness constraint
and it doesn't help to have it in a primary key index either since
we'll either search the table for a given port_id *or* search for
subports with a given trunk_id.

This patch does not add a migration.  Changing the primary key in an
alembic migration doesn't appear to be possible.  The original model
was not released in Mitaka.  Also, this is effectively a cosmetic
change, it doesn't really effect the operation of the DB.  So,
developers and trunk chasers who have deployed with the previous model
will still work.

neutron-db-manage to generate a migration script for new changes
having installed the old model.  That might produce changes that the
surprise the developer but isn't very likely.  Recommend always using
a fresh testdb to generate migration scripts.

commit_message:
Clean up subports model

First, the nullable attribute on port_id was redundant because it is
in the primary key.

Second, trunk_id shouldn't be in the primary key.  Since port_id was
already marked unique, it didn't add any extra uniqueness constraint
and it doesn't help to have it in a primary key index either since
we'll either search the table for a given port_id *or* search for
subports with a given trunk_id.

The original model was not released in Mitaka.  Also, this is
effectively a cosmetic change, it doesn't really effect the operation
of the DB.  So, developers and trunk chasers who have deployed with
the previous model will still work.

Change-Id: Ia43a2a772f654e26c3234e153fd8a5501e585c9b
Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
